definition[0]: the practice of not allowing someone or something into your country, organization etc - used especially about limits on trade which make it difficult for foreign companies to do business in a country
example[0]: From the 1960s the US maintained a closed-door policy toward the Cuban market.
definition[1]: the practice of refusing to discuss something with other people who do not belong to your government, organization etc
example[1]: The Canadian Government adopted a closed-door policy on the issue.
